trans-unit.source: Returns an object variable by name

seg-source.mrk: Returns an object variable by name

target.mrk: Returns an object variable by name

trans-unit.source: Object variable of an InternetExplorer.Application, Window or Frame object
Specifies name of the object you wish to match

seg-source.mrk: Specifies name of the object you wish to match

target.mrk: Specifies name of the object you wish to match

trans-unit.source: [optional] If name occurs more than once, specifies instance by 0-based index

seg-source.mrk: If name occurs more than once, specifies instance by 0-based index

target.mrk: If name occurs more than once, specifies instance by 0-based index

trans-unit.source: 0 (Default) or positive integer returns an indexed instance

seg-source.mrk: 0 (Default) or positive integer returns an indexed instance

target.mrk: 0 (Default) or positive integer returns an indexed instance

trans-unit.source: -1 returns a collection of the specified objects

seg-source.mrk: -1 returns a collection of the specified objects

target.mrk: -1 returns a collection of the specified objects

trans-unit.source: an object variable pointing to the specified Object, @extended = specified object count.

seg-source.mrk: an object variable pointing to the specified Object, @extended = specified object count.

target.mrk: an object variable pointing to the specified Object, @extended = specified object count.

trans-unit.source: This function will return an object reference to any object in the document with a specified name or id.

seg-source.mrk: This function will return an object reference to any object in the document with a specified name or id.

target.mrk: This function will return an object reference to any object in the document with a specified name or id.

trans-unit.source: DOM elements can have Name or ID attributes or both.

seg-source.mrk: DOM elements can have Name or ID attributes or both.

target.mrk: DOM elements can have Name or ID attributes or both.

trans-unit.source: A specific ID can be assigned to only a single element while a specific Name can be assigned to multiple elements.

seg-source.mrk: A specific ID can be assigned to only a single element while a specific Name can be assigned to multiple elements.

target.mrk: A specific ID can be assigned to only a single element while a specific Name can be assigned to multiple elements.

trans-unit.source: In Internet Explorer, the Name and ID namespaces are shared.

seg-source.mrk: In Internet Explorer, the Name and ID namespaces are shared.

target.mrk: In Internet Explorer, the Name and ID namespaces are shared.

trans-unit.source: Open a browser to the form example, get an object reference

seg-source.mrk: Open a browser to the form example, get an object reference

target.mrk: Open a browser to the form example, get an object reference

trans-unit.source: to the element with the name "ExampleForm". In this case the

seg-source.mrk: to the element with the name "ExampleForm".

target.mrk: to the element with the name "ExampleForm".
